children.name: Our Privacy Policy
Our Privacy Policy
Last Updated: Jan 15th, 2024

We are a wellness platform. We provide a digital platform with coaching and team challenges to help our members achieve their wellness goals. When you use these services, you’ll share some information with us. So we want to be upfront about the information we collect, how we use it, whom we share it with, and the controls we give you to access, update, and delete your information. That’s why we’ve written this Privacy Policy.
This Privacy Policy is incorporated by reference into our Terms of Service. So, please make sure that you have read and understand our Terms of Service (
Terms and Condition - Wellness Coach
Terms and Condition - Wellness Coach

All individuals whose responsibilities include the processing of any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person (“Personal Information”) on behalf of meditation.live are expected to protect that data by adherence to this Privacy Policy.
Information We Collect
Information We Collect
There are two basic categories of information we collect:
• Information you choose to give us.
Information you choose to give us.
• Information we get when you use our services.
Information we get when you use our services.
Here’s a little more detail on each of these categories.
Information You Choose to Give Us
Information You Choose to Give Us

When you interact with our services, we collect the information that you choose to share with us. For example, most of our services require you to set up an account or log into our services using 3rd party accounts such as Google and Facebook, so we need to collect a few important details about you, such as: a unique username you’d like to go by, a password, an email address, gender, city of user and age. To make it easier for others to find you, we may also ask you to provide us with some additional information that will be publicly visible on our services, such as profile pictures, a name, your current or other useful identifying information.

Health data Collection and Use: It's your choice to share your health data with us. You can choose what data you want to share with us. We collect this data from sources like Apple Health and Google Health and/or any wearables that may be connected to these sources or connected independently. This data is used to help our members understand their wellness patterns, and offer tailored recommendations. This data can include metrics related to sleep, walking, physical workouts, and other wellness indicators. We also use this information for team challenges as e.g. for walking challenges, we would sync step count from your device to our platform and update the leaderboards.

Health Data Consent: By connecting your Apple Health or Google Health or any account with health information with our platform, you provide explicit consent for us to access and use your health data as described in this privacy policy. You can revoke this consent at any time by disconnecting your health accounts or contacting our support team.

During live classes or (other future live offerings), you can choose to have your camera and microphone on. This allows you to interact with our Coaches and other students. We believe it's better to learn together. All these live sessions are recorded and may be used for promotions or future on-demand teachings, compliance with legal obligations or to enforce our
code of conduct
code of conduct
. If you don't want to be part of video and audio recording, simply keep your video turned off and audio muted.
It probably goes without saying: When you contact customer support or communicate with us in any other way, we’ll collect whatever information you volunteer.
Information We Get When You Use Our Services
Information We Get When You Use Our Services

When you use our services, we collect information about which of those services you’ve used and how you’ve used them. We might know, for instance, that you watched a particular on demand video, joined a live class or two. Here’s a fuller explanation of the types of information we collect when you use our services:

• Usage Information. We collect information about your activity through our services. For example, we may collect information about how you interact with our services, how often you use our services, what's the best time of meditation for you and so on.

Usage Information. We collect information about your activity through our services. For example, we may collect information about how you interact with our services, how often you use our services, what's the best time of meditation for you and so on.
• Content Information. We collect profile picture, name, email, city, gender, age and audio or video recordings that are created by joining live sessions.
Content Information. We collect profile picture, name, email, city, gender, age and audio or video recordings that are created by joining live sessions.
• Device Information. We collect information from and about the devices you use. For example, we collect:
Device Information. We collect information from and about the devices you use. For example, we collect:
◦ information about your hardware and software, such as the hardware model, operating system version, language, battery level, and time zone;
information about your hardware and software, such as the hardware model, operating system version, language, battery level, and time zone;
◦ information from microphones, and whether you have headphones connected; and
information from microphones, and whether you have headphones connected; and
◦ information about your wireless and mobile network connections, service provider, and signal strength.
information about your wireless and mobile network connections, service provider, and signal strength.
• Camera and Photos. You may use the camera for interacting with Coaches and students in the class and photos to update your profile picture.
Camera and Photos. You may use the camera for interacting with Coaches and students in the class and photos to update your profile picture.
• Location Information. We ask for location to share where you are joining from to the class. It's always exciting to see fellow users from all parts of the world.
Location Information. We ask for location to share where you are joining from to the class. It's always exciting to see fellow users from all parts of the world.

• Information Collected by Cookies and Other Technologies. Like most online services and mobile applications, we may use cookies and other technologies, such as web beacons, web storage, and unique advertising identifiers, to collect information about your activity, browser, and device. Most web browsers are set to accept cookies by default. If you prefer, you can usually remove or reject browser cookies through the settings on your browser or device. Keep in mind, though, that removing or rejecting cookies could affect the availability and functionality of our services such as keeping you logged in, having the correct time zone for class schedule and reminder notifications.

Information Collected by Cookies and Other Technologies. Like most online services and mobile applications, we may use cookies and other technologies, such as web beacons, web storage, and unique advertising identifiers, to collect information about your activity, browser, and device. Most web browsers are set to accept cookies by default. If you prefer, you can usually remove or reject browser cookies through the settings on your browser or device. Keep in mind, though, that removing or rejecting cookies could affect the availability and functionality of our services such as keeping you logged in, having the correct time zone for class schedule and reminder notifications.

• Health Information: No Individual Data Sharing with Employers: We prioritize your privacy. When sharing aggregated wellness metrics with employers or other third-party organizations, we provide data in an anonymized and aggregated format. This ensures that individual health data points cannot be traced back to a specific member. Your personal health metrics are for your eyes and our platform's analysis only, not for your employer or any third-party to view on an individualized basis.

Health Information: No Individual Data Sharing with Employers: We prioritize your privacy. When sharing aggregated wellness metrics with employers or other third-party organizations, we provide data in an anonymized and aggregated format. This ensures that individual health data points cannot be traced back to a specific member. Your personal health metrics are for your eyes and our platform's analysis only, not for your employer or any third-party to view on an individualized basis.
• Log Information. We also collect log information when you use our website. That information includes, among other things:
Log Information. We also collect log information when you use our website. That information includes, among other things:
◦ details about how you’ve used our services.
details about how you’ve used our services.
◦ device information, such as your web browser type and language.
device information, such as your web browser type and language.
◦ access times.
access times.
◦ pages viewed.
pages viewed.
◦ IP address.
IP address.
◦ identifiers associated with cookies or other technologies that may uniquely identify your device or browser.
identifiers associated with cookies or other technologies that may uniquely identify your device or browser.
◦ Device type such as iOS or Android etc
Device type such as iOS or Android etc
◦ pages you visited before or after navigating to our website.
pages you visited before or after navigating to our website.
How We Use Information
How We Use Information
What do we do with the information we collect? We provide you with features that we relentlessly improve. Here are the ways we do that:
• Develop, operate, improve, deliver, maintain, and protect our products and services.
Develop, operate, improve, deliver, maintain, and protect our products and services.

• Send you communications, including by email add app notifications. For example, we may use email to respond to support inquiries or to share information about our products, services, and promotional offers that we think may interest you.

Send you communications, including by email add app notifications. For example, we may use email to respond to support inquiries or to share information about our products, services, and promotional offers that we think may interest you.
• Monitor and analyze trends and usage.
Monitor and analyze trends and usage.
• Personalize your services
Personalize your services
• Enhance the safety and security of our products and services.
Enhance the safety and security of our products and services.
• Verify your identity and prevent fraud or other unauthorized or illegal activity.
Verify your identity and prevent fraud or other unauthorized or illegal activity.
• Use information we’ve collected from cookies and other technology to enhance our services and your experience with them.
Use information we’ve collected from cookies and other technology to enhance our services and your experience with them.
• Enforce our Terms of Service and other usage policies.
Enforce our Terms of Service and other usage policies.
How We Share Information
How We Share Information
We may share information about you in the following ways:
With Coaches and other users.
We may share the following information with Coaches or users:
• Information about you, such as your username, name, and profile picture.
Information about you, such as your username, name, and profile picture.

• Information about how you have interacted with our services, such as how often you use the platform, the names of users you are connected with, and other information that will help users understand your connections with others using our services.

Information about how you have interacted with our services, such as how often you use the platform, the names of users you are connected with, and other information that will help users understand your connections with others using our services.
• Any additional information you have directed us to share.
Any additional information you have directed us to share.
• Content you post or live sessions you are part of.
Content you post or live sessions you are part of.
With all users, our business partners, and the general public.
We may share the following information with all users as well as with our business partners and the general public:
• Public information like your name, username or profile pictures.
Public information like your name, username or profile pictures.
With third parties.
We may share your information with the following third parties:
• With service providers. We may share information about you with service providers who perform services on our behalf.
With service providers. We may share information about you with service providers who perform services on our behalf.
• With business partners. We may share information about you with business partners that provide services and functionality.
With business partners. We may share information about you with business partners that provide services and functionality.
• With third parties for legal reasons. We may share information about you if we reasonably believe that disclosing the information is needed to:
With third parties for legal reasons. We may share information about you if we reasonably believe that disclosing the information is needed to:
◦ Comply with any valid legal process, governmental request, or applicable law, rule, or regulation.
Comply with any valid legal process, governmental request, or applicable law, rule, or regulation.
◦ Investigate, remedy, or enforce potential Terms of Service violations.
Investigate, remedy, or enforce potential Terms of Service violations.
◦ Protect the rights, property, and safety of us, our users, or others.
Protect the rights, property, and safety of us, our users, or others.
◦ Detect and resolve any fraud or security concerns.
Detect and resolve any fraud or security concerns.

• With third parties as part of a merger or acquisition. If Meditation.LIVE Inc. gets involved in a merger, asset sale, financing, liquidation or bankruptcy, or acquisition of all or some portion of our business to another company, we may share your information with that company before and after the transaction closes.

With third parties as part of a merger or acquisition. If Meditation.LIVE Inc. gets involved in a merger, asset sale, financing, liquidation or bankruptcy, or acquisition of all or some portion of our business to another company, we may share your information with that company before and after the transaction closes.
Single Sign-On (SSO)
Single Sign-On (SSO)

For our enterprise clients, we offer Single Sign-On (SSO) capabilities to streamline the login process and enhance security. When you or your employees use SSO to access our services, we collect and manage the following information:

- SSO Authentication Data: We collect information required to authenticate your identity through your enterprise SSO provider. This may include your username, email address, and an authentication token. We do not receive or store your SSO password.

- Integration with Enterprise Systems: Our platform integrates with your enterprise's SSO system. This integration is designed to respect user privacy and security, handling data in accordance with both our Privacy Policy and your enterprise's privacy standards.

- Data Security and Privacy: We employ robust security measures to ensure the integrity and confidentiality of SSO data. We commit to protecting this information from unauthorized access and disclosure.

- Data Usage: The information collected via SSO is used solely for authentication and reporting purposes and to provide a seamless user experience. It is not used for any other purpose without explicit consent.

- Enterprise Responsibility: The enterprise is responsible for maintaining the confidentiality and security of SSO login credentials. Users should contact their enterprise IT department for any SSO-related issues or concerns.

- Compliance and Cooperation: We adhere to all relevant laws and regulations regarding data privacy and protection in our handling of SSO data. We will cooperate with enterprises to ensure compliance with their internal policies and legal obligations.
By using SSO to access our services, users agree to the terms outlined in this section, in addition to the broader terms of our Privacy Policy.
Third-Party Content and Integrations
Third-Party Content and Integrations

Our services may also contain third-party links and search results, include third-party integrations, or offer a co-branded or third-party-branded service. Through these links, third-party integrations, and co-branded or third-party-branded services, you may be providing information (including personal information) directly to the third party, us, or both. You acknowledge and agree that we are not responsible for how those third parties collect or use your information. As always, we encourage you to review the privacy policies of every third-party service that you visit or use, including those third parties you interact with through our services.
Users in the European Union
Users in the European Union

If you're a user in the European Union, you should know that 'Meditation.LIVE Inc'. is the controller of your personal information. Here is some additional information we would like to bring to your attention:
Bases for using your information
Bases for using your information
Your country only allows us to use your personal information when certain conditions apply. These conditions are called “legal bases” and, at Meditation.LIVE, we typically rely on one of four:
• Contract. One reason we might use your information is because you’ve entered into an agreement with us.
Contract. One reason we might use your information is because you’ve entered into an agreement with us.
• Legitimate interest. Another reason we might use your information is because we have—or a third party has—a legitimate interest in doing so.
Legitimate interest. Another reason we might use your information is because we have—or a third party has—a legitimate interest in doing so.

• Consent. In some cases we’ll ask for consent to use your information for specific purposes. If we do, we’ll make sure you can revoke your consent in our services or through your device permissions. Even if we’re not relying on consent to use your information, we may ask you for permission to access data like contacts and location.

Consent. In some cases we’ll ask for consent to use your information for specific purposes. If we do, we’ll make sure you can revoke your consent in our services or through your device permissions. Even if we’re not relying on consent to use your information, we may ask you for permission to access data like contacts and location.
• Legal obligation. We may be required to use your personal information to comply with the law, like when we respond to valid legal process or need to take action to protect our users.
Legal obligation. We may be required to use your personal information to comply with the law, like when we respond to valid legal process or need to take action to protect our users.
EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) Compliance
EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) Compliance
For our users in the European Union, we adhere strictly to the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) requirements. The following outlines our commitment:
-Data Controller: Meditation.LIVE Inc. is the data controller of your personal information.
We are responsible for ensuring that your data is processed in compliance with this Privacy Policy and GDPR.
- Legal Basis for Processing: We process your personal data on the following legal bases:
- Consent: We process certain data based on your consent, which you can withdraw at any time.
- Contractual Necessity: We process personal data as necessary to fulfill our contractual obligations to you.
- Compliance with Legal Obligations: We process your data when required by law.
- Legitimate Interests: We process your data when we have a legitimate interest in doing so, and this interest is not overridden by your data protection rights.

- User Rights: As an EU resident, you have specific rights regarding your personal data. These include the right to access, correct, delete, or port your data, and the right to object to or restrict certain processing of your data.
- Data Transfer Outside the EU: If we transfer your data outside the EU, we ensure adequate protection is in place to safeguard your data, in compliance with GDPR.

- Data Protection Officer (DPO): We have appointed a Data Protection Officer to oversee our management of your personal data in accordance with GDPR. You can contact our DPO for any concerns or questions about our data practices.
- Complaints: If you have concerns about our data practices, you have the right to lodge a complaint with a data protection authority in your country or region.
We are committed to upholding your rights under GDPR and ensuring the protection and privacy of your personal information.
Your right to object
Your right to object
You have the right to object to our use of your information. Contact us at support[at]wellnesscoach(.)live for any data you want us to delete or not use.
Revisions to the Privacy Policy
Revisions to the Privacy Policy

We may change this Privacy Policy from time to time. But when we do, we’ll let you know one way or another. Sometimes, we’ll let you know by revising the date at the top of the Privacy Policy that’s available on our website and mobile application. Other times, we may provide you with additional notice (such as adding a statement to our websites’ homepages or providing you with an in-app notification).
